messages: The Universal Reporting system is performing exceptionally well under stress test conditions.
All performance metrics are within optimal ranges.
The system demonstrates excellent scalability and reliability.

details.performance: Response times are consistently fast with minimal variance.
details.reliability: Success rates are at or above target levels.
details.resources: System resource utilization is efficient and sustainable.

messages: The Universal Reporting system is performing well with minor areas for improvement.
Most metrics are within acceptable ranges.
The system is stable and reliable under normal load conditions.
recommendations: Consider optimizing database queries for better response times.
Monitor system resources during peak loads.
Review and optimize event processing batch sizes.

messages: The Universal Reporting system is functioning but showing signs of stress.
Several metrics are approaching warning thresholds.
Performance optimization is recommended before production deployment.
recommendations: Implement caching strategies to reduce database load.
Optimize trigger evaluation logic for better performance.
Consider horizontal scaling for improved throughput.

messages: The Universal Reporting system is struggling under load.
Multiple performance metrics are outside acceptable ranges.
Immediate optimization is required before production use.
recommendations: Conduct detailed performance profiling to identify bottlenecks.
Implement connection pooling and query optimization.
Consider architectural changes to improve scalability.
Add monitoring and alerting for critical metrics.
Review system capacity and consider infrastructure upgrades.

messages: The Universal Reporting system is experiencing critical performance issues.
The system is not suitable for production use in its current state.
Major architectural or infrastructure changes are required.
recommendations: Immediately investigate and resolve system bottlenecks.
Consider complete architectural review and redesign.
Implement comprehensive caching and optimization strategies.
Engage performance engineering experts for consultation.
Implement circuit breakers and fallback mechanisms.

responseTime.excellent: Response times are blazing fast, providing excellent user experience.
responseTime.good: Response times are within acceptable ranges for most operations.
responseTime.poor: Response times are slow and may impact user satisfaction.
responseTime.critical: Response times are critically slow and will severely impact usability.

throughput.excellent: System throughput exceeds expectations, handling high volumes efficiently.
throughput.good: System throughput is adequate for expected load levels.
throughput.poor: System throughput is below requirements and may cause backlogs.
throughput.critical: System throughput is critically low and cannot handle production loads.

successRate.excellent: Near-perfect success rates demonstrate excellent system reliability.
successRate.good: Success rates are high with occasional failures within tolerance.
successRate.poor: Success rates are concerning with frequent operation failures.
successRate.critical: Success rates are unacceptably low with widespread failures.

cpu.excellent: CPU utilization is optimal with plenty of headroom for growth.
cpu.good: CPU utilization is reasonable with some capacity for increased load.
cpu.poor: CPU utilization is high and may become a bottleneck.
cpu.critical: CPU is at or near capacity, causing performance degradation.

memory.excellent: Memory usage is efficient with no signs of leaks or pressure.
memory.good: Memory usage is stable with adequate free memory available.
memory.poor: Memory usage is high with potential leak or inefficiency issues.
memory.critical: Memory is exhausted or growing uncontrollably, system stability at risk.
